intro: Susilkumara anomala, commonly known as the mountain orchid, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in shades of white and pale pink. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and requires well-drained, acidic soil to flourish. Due to its limited habitat and sensitivity to environmental changes, it is considered a vulnerable species. Its unique morphology and ecological significance make it an important subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
